TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}
TEXT.source: ti Sapayas katua ła Qavulung (Tjakuvukuvuł village, p.207)

S.FORM: ka sitsuayan izua ti Sapayas; vaik a sema Velikił.
ka sicoayan izoa ti Sapayas; vaik a sema Velikilj.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time someone called Sapayas went to Velikił.
He met people of the Qavulung family,

S.FORM: qau małavar tua kadjunangan i Velikił.
qao maljavar toa kadjonangan i Velikilj.
S.TRANSL: and they discussed the land at Velikił.

S.FORM: "muri a niaken tsu a kadjunangan," aya ti Sapayas.
"mori a niaken co a kadjonangan," aya ti Sapayas.
S.TRANSL: “This land will be mine,” said Sapayas.

S.FORM: manu "a niamen tsu a kadjunangan," aya marivu tiamadju.
mano "a niamen co a kadjonangan," aya marivo tiamadjo.
S.TRANSL: But they disagreed; “This land is ours,” they said.

S.FORM: "metsevung anga a małavar nu tjaivilił," aya, sa vaik a mavaday.
"mecevong anga a maljavar no tjaivililj," aya, sa vaik a mavaday.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll meet to discuss it later,” they said, and went their separate ways.

S.FORM: tsuatsuay anga pagału, qau metsevung sema zua i Pinaqaqułatan.
coacoay anga pagaljo, qao mecevong sema zoa i Pinaqaqoljatan.
S.TRANSL: After quite a little time they met at Pinaqaqułatan.

S.FORM: matsidił ti Sapayas; a se Vulavulat izua mapułat.
macidilj ti Sapayas; a se Volavolat izoa mapoljat.
S.TRANSL: Sapayas was on his own, but all the Vulavulat people were there.
“Let’s discuss the land,” said Sapayas.
But the Qavulung family said, “Come on, let’s fight!”
Sapayas was shot at.
“Don’t shoot!
Let’s talk,” said Sapayas.
They didn’t listen, and kept on shooting.

S.FORM: a nu panaqen, ipuq ti Sapayas; ini kadjameq.
a no panaqen, ipoq ti Sapayas; ini kadjameq.
S.TRANSL: When he was shot at, Sapayas lay down, and wasn’t hit.
“Don’t shoot!
Let’s talk,” said Sapayas.

S.FORM: ini langeda ła Qavulung; kamayan a panaq.
ini langeda lja Qavolong; kamayan a panaq.
S.TRANSL: The Qavulung family didn’t listen, and kept on shooting.
“If you challenge me, just wait a bit.

S.FORM: temałiw anan aken tua ku tseqełap," aya ti Sapayas.
temaljiw anan aken toa ko ceqeljap," aya ti Sapayas.
S.TRANSL: I’ll just sharpen my sword,” said Sapayas.
Sapayas sharpened it;
and fire burst out all over the level land.
The fire reached Riłuriłuan.
“Hey, no!
This is no good.
We won’t be able to stand this.

S.FORM: tja kaviladay," aya ła Qavulung, sa kavilad.
tja kaviladay," aya lja Qavolong, sa kavilad.
S.TRANSL: We’ll run away,” said the Qavulung family, and they ran away.
“That’s enough.

S.FORM: nia sisaluan anga a kadjunangan," ayain ni Qavulung ti Sapayas.
nia sisaloan anga a kadjonangan," ayain ni Qavolong ti Sapayas.
S.TRANSL: We concede the land,” said Qavulung to Sapayas.
So that was the end (or So he was victorious).

S.FORM: saka ni Sapayas a kadjunangan tutsu azazua i Velikił, aya a tjautsikel.
saka ni Sapayas a kadjonangan toco azazoa i Velikilj, aya a tjaocikel.
S.TRANSL: And the land at Velikił belongs to Sapayas now, according to the story.
